name: df-q1p
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5
body: |- wceq(cq1p, cmpt(s0, universe, csb(s1, cfv(cpl1, cv(s0)), csb(s2, cfv(cbs, cv(s1)), cmpo(s3, s4, cv(s2), cv(s2), crio(s5, cv(s2), wbr(cfv(cfv(cdg1, cv(s0)), co(cv(s3), cfv(csg, cv(s1)), co(cv(s5), cfv(cmulr, cv(s1)), cv(s4)))), clt, cfv(cfv(cdg1, cv(s0)), cv(s4)))))))))
bodyPretty: ‚ä¢ quot1p =(s0 ‚àà ùïå ‚Ü¶[(Poly1 ` s0)/ s1][(Base ` s1)/ s2](s3 ‚àà s2, s4 ‚àà s2 ‚Ü¶ iota(s5 ‚àà s2,((deg1 ` s0)`(s3[(-g ` s1)](s5[(√ó ` s1)]s4)))[<]((deg1 ` s0)` s4))))
comment: Define the quotient of two univariate polynomials, which is guaranteed to exist and be unique by ~ ply1divalg . We actually use the reversed version for better harmony with our divisibility ~ df-dvdsr . (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 28-Mar-2015.)
